sections.title: Why Budgeting Matters
sections.content: A budget is your financial roadmap. It helps you understand where your money goes, ensures you can cover essential expenses, and helps you save for future goals. Without a budget, it's easy to overspend and wonder where all your money went at the end of the month.

sections.title: The 50/30/20 Rule
sections.content: A popular budgeting method that divides your after-tax income into three categories: 50% for needs (rent, utilities, groceries), 30% for wants (entertainment, dining out), and 20% for savings and debt repayment

sections.title: Create Your Budget
steps: Calculate your monthly income after taxes
List all fixed expenses (rent, insurance, loans)
Track variable expenses for one month
Categorize spending into needs, wants, and savings
Adjust and balance to ensure income exceeds expenses

points.title: Zero-Based Budgeting
points.description: Every dollar of income is assigned a purpose. Income minus expenses equals zero.

points.title: Envelope System
points.description: Cash is divided into envelopes for different spending categories. When an envelope is empty, spending stops.

points.title: Pay Yourself First
points.description: Savings and investments are treated as the first 'bill' to pay each month.

sections.title: Pro Tip
sections.content: Start with a simple spreadsheet or budgeting app. Track everything for one month without judgment to understand your current spending patterns. Then make adjustments based on your goals.
